config.question: Which of the following is a major difference between the migrations to Massachusetts and the migrations to Virginia?

choices.content: Migrants moved to Massachusetts as nuclear families whereas the migrants to Virginia were usually unmarried males.
Most of the migrants to Massachusetts were more affluent than the migrants to Virginia, who were predominantly slaves.
The migrants to Massachusetts were Roman Catholics, while the migrants to Virginia were Shakers who promoted celibacy.
The majority of the migrants to Virginia were relatively affluent, whereas most of the migrants to Massachusetts were impoverished.

answer_3.response: Consider This: The colony’s sex ratio was more balanced than that found in the Chesapeake colonies. Once they had arrived in Massachusetts, these men and women survived. The life expectancy of men and women after they arrived in Massachusetts compares favorably to that of modern Americans. See L.O. 2.2 How did differences in religion affect the founding of the New England colonies?
